title: No project listed in the projects page | 404 Error
body:
Hello everyone.
First I've tried to use the newest version of doccano using the docker. It appeared to be fine, none of the users, even Admin could reach the projects page, though. There was always 404 error. Well, when the admin creates the project on the web interface, it appears until the next log in. Then the page again could not be found (404 error) 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51916323/69699433-f1a0c300-10f8-11ea-83b4-50f9ac4f5489.png)
So, due to that, the decision to use an older version of doccano was made. 
It was compiled from the binaries. Everything seemed to be fine, except for no role were available. So I created two roles (the spelling really matters, otherwise nothing will work). But as soon as I did it, admin no longer can see any of the projects on the web interface (I even tried to create the other user with admin privileges, the same thing). So I have to put the url myself, which is not comfortable.. At least, I cannot see the name of the project, so have to memorize the project id..
One more thing to mention, now admin is never greeted by the web interface with it's name. on the name spot just space. I guess it actually the main problem here since the user with such a name naturally is not allowed to view projects.
![Сни22мок](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51916323/69700139-c919c880-10fa-11ea-8476-59b14045ece7.JPG)

Any ideas on how to solve it?
Thank you a lot.
---------

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04
*   Python Version Used: 3.7
*   When you install doccano: Yesterday
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): 1st - Docker. 2nd - build binaries
